item.title: Durability of resistance to Meloidogyne mediated by R-genes in solanaceous and cucurbitaceous crops
item.author: helio4gm@gmail.com (Helio)
item.description: body { text-align: justify} Abstract The response of two Citrullus amarus accessions, BGV0005164 and BGV0005167, was assessed against different Meloidogyne arenaria, Meloidogyne incognita, and Meloidogyne javanica isolates in pot experiments and against M. incognita in plastic greenhouse. In the pot experiments, plants were inoculated with a second-stage juvenile per cm3 of sterile sand and maintained in a growth chamber at 25 C for 50 days. The watermelon cv. Sugar Baby was included as a susceptible control for comparison.
item.dc:creator: Helio
